scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there's an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. Previously, you chose to guide your colleague over the phone, but then [Monica] and [Bob] joined the conversation. [Monica] showed understanding, while [Bob] seemed frustrated. You chose to prioritize your time off, asking them to find another solution. [Monica] then expressed concern, and [Bob] became more agitated. You responded by saying you would think about it and get back to them. [Monica] looks hopeful, while [Bob] is still visibly upset.
scenes.description: [Monica] gently asks, 'Alex, any updates on your decision? We really need your expertise on this.' [Bob] interrupts, 'We can't afford to wait much longer. Can you just help us out already?'

options.text: I’m still considering it. I'll let you know soon.
options.analysis: You provide an ambiguous response, showing moderate emotional perception and self-regulation, but lower motivation.

options.text: Alright, I’ll help you out right now.
options.analysis: You agree to assist immediately, indicating high empathy but lower self-regulation as you yield to pressure.

options.text: This really isn't a good time. I need my rest.
options.analysis: You firmly set your boundaries, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.
